plugin.name: default_character_config - core
plugin.description: The choices you are about to make will impact the "default" player character (the character which gets utilized by new games as well as by the "coc" console command - when the command is used from the main menu without any save having been loaded since the game launched). This is safe to install, change, or uninstall at any time. By default, configs will remove all starting spells from the player character (including racial spells, though lesser/greater powers and passives are left intact). The configs will also replace starting items rather than merely adding additional starting items. To change your choices at a later date, simply re-run this configuration process.

plugin.name: Argonian - Female
plugin.description: This reptilian race, well-suited for the treacherous swamps of their Black Marsh homeland, has developed a natural resistance to diseases and the ability to breathe underwater. They can call upon the Histskin to regenerate health very quickly.

plugin.name: Breton - Female
plugin.description: In addition to their quick and perceptive grasp of spellcraft, even the humblest of High Rock's Bretons can boast a resistance to magic. Bretons can call upon the Dragonskin power to absorb spells.

plugin.name: Dark Elf - Female
plugin.description: Also known as "Dunmer" in their homeland of Morrowind, dark elves are noted for their stealth and magic skills. They are naturally resistant to fire and can call upon their Ancestor's Wrath to surround themselves in fire.

plugin.name: High Elf - Female
plugin.description: Also known as "Altmer" in their homeland of Summerset Isle, the high elves are the most strongly gifted in the arcane arts of all the races. They can call upon their Highborn power to regenerate Magicka quickly.

plugin.name: Imperial - Female
plugin.description: Natives of Cyrodiil, they have proved to be shrewd diplomats and traders. They are skilled with combat and magic. Anywhere gold coins might be found, Imperials always seem to find a few more. They can call upon the Voice of the Emperor to calm an enemy.

plugin.name: Khajiit - Female
plugin.description: Hailing from the province of Elsweyr, they are intelligent, quick, and agile. They make excellent thieves due to their natural stealthiness. All Khajiit can see in the dark at will and have unarmed claw attacks.

plugin.name: Nord - Female
plugin.description: Citizens of Skyrim, they are a tall and fair-haired people. Strong and hardy, Nords are famous for their resistance to cold and their talent as warriors. They can use a Battlecry to make opponents flee.

plugin.description: Citizens of Skyrim, they are a tall and fair-haired people. Strong and hardy, Nords are famous for their resistance to cold and their talent as warriors. They can use a Battlecry to make opponents flee.

plugin.name: Orc - Female
plugin.description: The people of the Wrothgarian and Dragontail Mountains, Orcish smiths are prized for their craftsmanship. Orc troops in Heavy Armor are among the finest in the Empire, and are fearsome when using their Berserker Rage.

plugin.name: Redguard - Female
plugin.description: The most naturally talented warriors in Tamriel, the Redguards of Hammerfell have a hardy constitution and a natural resistance to poison. They can call upon an Adrenaline Rush in combat.

plugin.name: Redguard - Male
plugin.description: The most naturally talented warriors in Tamriel, the Redguards of Hammerfell have a hardy constitution and a natural resistance to poison. They can call upon an Adrenaline Rush in combat.

plugin.name: Wood Elf - Female
plugin.description: The clanfolk of the Western Valenwood forests, also known as "Bosmer." Wood elves make good scouts and thieves, and there are no finer archers in all of Tamriel. They have natural resistances to both poisons and diseases. They can Command Animals to fight for them.

plugin.name: Apprentice Stone
plugin.description: Those under the sign of The Apprentice recover Magicka faster, but are more susceptible to Magicka damage.

plugin.name: Atronach Stone
plugin.description: Those under the sign of The Atronach absorb a portion of incoming spell damage and have a larger pool of Magicka, but recover it more slowly.

plugin.name: Lady Stone
plugin.description: Those under the sign of The Lady regenerate Health and Stamina more quickly.

plugin.name: Lord Stone
plugin.description: Those under the sign of The Lord are more resistant to both Magicka and physical damage.

plugin.name: Lover Stone
plugin.description: Those under the sign of The Lover always feel a Lover's Comfort. (All skills improve faster.)

plugin.name: Mage Stone
plugin.description: Those under the sign of The Mage will learn all magic skills 20% faster.

plugin.name: Ritual Stone
plugin.description: Once a day, those under the sign of The Ritual can reanimate nearby corpses to fight for them.

plugin.name: Serpent Stone
plugin.description: Once a day, those under the sign of The Serpent can use a ranged paralyzing poison on opponents.

plugin.name: Shadow Stone
plugin.description: Once a day, those under the sign of The Shadow can become invisible for an extended period.

plugin.name: Steed Stone
plugin.description: Those under the sign of The Steed can carry more and do not suffer a movement penalty from armor.

plugin.name: Thief Stone
plugin.description: Those under the sign of The Thief will learn all stealth skills 20% faster.

plugin.name: Tower Stone
plugin.description: Those under the sign of The Tower have the option to automatically open Expert or lower locks.

plugin.name: Warrior Stone
plugin.description: Those under the sign of The Warrior will learn all combat skills 20% faster.

plugin.name: Beggar
plugin.description: Start with the clothes of the truly depraved, 10 septims, a single lockpick, an iron dagger, and a torch you snatched off the wall of a mostly forgotten alley.

plugin.name: Mod Author - Alchemy
plugin.description: Minimize the need for the console by starting with every potion and 5 of each ingredient.

plugin.name: Guard of Whiterun
plugin.description: Start with equipment from the city armory, 250 septims, 5 torches, a hunting bow, steel arrows, potions, and a snack.

plugin.name: Guild - Assassin
plugin.description: Start with Dark Brotherhood armor, 200 septims (not stolen, technically speaking), 10 lockpicks, 3 torches, an exceptionally well-made steel dagger, several potions, some poisons, and one incredibly well-preserved wooden bow from an ancient tomb. The bow has an exceedingly heavy draw.

plugin.name: Guild - Mage
plugin.description: Start with college robes, 200 septims (for tuition), 3 lockpicks (strictly for research purposes, of course), a single torch, a small number of potions, several destruction scrolls (fire-based), a weighty staff of incineration, and an enchanted dagger to complement the full array of white soul gems.

plugin.name: Guild - Vampire Hunter (Heavy)
plugin.description: Start with Dawnguard heavy armor, 100 septims, 4 lockpicks, plenty of torches, a fair amount of healing and disease curing potions, a crossbow, and bludgeoning weapons built specifically for slaying vampires.

plugin.name: Guild - Vampire Hunter (Light)
plugin.description: Start with Dawnguard light armor, 100 septims, 4 lockpicks, plenty of torches, a fair amount of healing and disease curing potions, a crossbow, and bludgeoning weapons built specifically for slaying vampires.

plugin.name: Heavy
plugin.description: Start with a set of heavy iron armor, 500 septims for a squire, 2 torches, potions necessary for melee combat, and an impressive arsenal of Dwarven axes and hammers.

plugin.name: Hunter
plugin.description: Start with warm fur armor and a matching hood which seems to add a directional quality to the wearer's sense of sound. Additionally, a very dependable recurve hunting bow, and salts suitable for starting fires and cooking. The natural inclusion of both hatchet and steel dagger ensure a long stay from town is both possible and pleasant.

plugin.name: Knight
plugin.description: Start with a full set of heavy steel plate, a silver sword, a silver greatsword, 5 torches, and potions suitable for a variety of combat styles as well as protection from disease. Finally, an amulet of Akatosh and scrolls to protect from the undead.

plugin.name: Cleric
plugin.description: Start with earth-toned hooded robes, an amulet of Arkay, 5 torches, several potions, a blessed steel mace, and several scrolls to help keep companions alive and undead at bay.

plugin.name: Necromancer
plugin.description: Start with black robes, a sinister orcish mace of souls, 5 lockpicks, 2 torches, a handful of black gems, and ingedients that appear suitable for concocting a poison prone to causing the afflicted (afflicted innocents, preferably) to suffer bitterly painful deaths.

plugin.name: Rogue
plugin.description: Start with Linwe's armor, 300 septims, 15 lockpicks, a steel dagger which could be recognized as wrought by Eorlund Gray-Mane by anyone with a discerning eye (which the merchant who traded it for garnets-passed-off-as-rubies evidently lacked), 3 torches, several potions, and a standard-issue recurve bow (made exactly to imperial spec for the officer it was "retrieved" on behalf of).
